column1:
## Reason for admission
69-year-old man admitted on 2024-01-01 with shortness of breath that he got a couple of days after a stay in Spain.

## Medical history
Parkinson's disease. Diabetes mellitus type 2. Stroke in Spain four months ago.

## Hospital course 
DT pulmonary arteries without signs of pulmonary embolism or pericardial fluid. Normal EF. MetHb 5.6. Hb 96. No signs of infection in lab. Hence hypoxia and anemia of unclear nature. Received oxygen. Hb initially falling from 96 to 83. Target saturation > 90%. It appears that the patient had unprotected sex and had a fever and skin rash as a result. Also weight loss of 10kg since October. Tested positive for HIV. Was informed about the diagnosis and treatment with Truvada and Tivicay was started after consultation with the infection diseases doctor. Lab with image as in hemolytic anemia after discussion with the hematologist. In the neurological status we forund bradykinesia, rigidity as in Parkinson's disease and positive Babinski's sign was found bilaterally. Also, fasciculations in the hands. Investigated with MRI of the brain and spine without signs of ALS or Parkinson's plus. EMG was performed and showed findings consistent with diffuse lower motor neuron involvement. LP with no anomalous findings so far. No neuromuscular etiology has been found. Neurological symptoms can be explained by sepsis? The patient saturates at 94% on room air and is discharged from the ward.

## Medications
- Omeprazole (Omeprazole) PO 20 Mg 1+0+0
- Eliquis (Apixaban) PO 5 Mg 1+0+1
- Betolvex (Cyanocobalamin) PO 1 Mg 1+0+0
- Madopark (Benserazide, Levodopa) PO 100/25 Mg 2+1+1+1
- Requip Depot (Ropinirole) PO 4 Mg 2+0+0
- Mirtazapine (Mirtazapine) PO 15 Mg 0+0+1
- Tivicay (Dolutegravir) PO 50 Mg 0+0+0
- Truvada (Emtricitabine/Tenofovir disoproxil) PO

## Plan after discharge
Follow-up at the coagulation clinic, infectious disease and neurology department.

## Diagnosis
- Sepsis
- Parkinson's disease
- Hypertension
- DVT

## Main diagnosis (name and ICD code)
B23.8 HIV infection
D59.9 Acquired hemolytic anemia, unspecified
